text: the following report contains some
disturbing images
activists say this is the grim result of
a siege that's gone on for six months
with no food at all reaching the town of
Madaya since October
this little boy gave his name as
muhammad Issa we believe these pictures
show him talking to a doctor recently he
said it's been a whole week since he had
anything at all to eat what would he
like most he was asked something sweet
he said you're not hungry we are shouts
this angry man at a fighter tempers are
getting frayed conditions in the
blockaded town have got even worse with
the arrival of winter back in October
when the last food got in things were
already bad enough we saw a huge lack of
basic needs such as food water medicine
we couldn't access media or other areas
since October 2015 so yes in the
situation is extremely tired we are very
very concerned the plight of medea has
prompted angry demonstrations by
sympathizers in other rebel-held areas
further north this man warned that if
the siege of medea wasn't lifted to
government-held villages besieged by the
rebels would be attacked and destroyed
that threat has been repeated by other
rebel military commanders the fate of
medea has been linked to that of the two
government-held villages Fuwa and
kefraya just a little further north
under an agreement rebel fighters have
been evacuated from a town near medea
and some pro-government fighters taken
out of their two villages
but that agreements now stalled the
sieges go on and so too does the
suffering Jim your BBC News Beirut
